iot.title: Real-Time IoT Imaging with Deep Neural Networks
iot.author: Nicolas Modrzyk
iot.description: An in-depth study of applying deep neural networks for real-time image processing and analysis in Internet of Things (IoT) systems.

iot.title: Applied Learning Algorithms for Intelligent IoT
iot.author: Pethuru Raj Chelliah, Usha Sakthivel, Susila Nagarajan
iot.description: A comprehensive guide exploring how intelligent algorithms enhance data processing, decision-making, and automation in modern Internet of Things (IoT) applications.

iot.title: IoT Sensor-Based Activity Recognition
iot.author: Md Atiqur Rahman Ahad, Anindya Das Antar, Masud Ahmed
iot.description: A detailed exploration of using IoT sensor data and machine learning techniques to recognize and analyze human activities in real time.

iot.title: Beginning Azure IoT Edge Computing
iot.author: David Jensen
iot.description:
About the Book This book demystifies edge computing by guiding developers through the Azure IoT Edge platform with practical, hands-on exercises to build and deploy intelligent solutions. It helps architects determine when to leverage the edge versus the cloud, covering essential patterns, container usage, and secure device provisioning. By the end, readers will understand how to extend cloud intelligence to edge devices effectively and securely.

Chapters List

Do I Need an Intelligent Edge?

Azure IoT Edge Core Concepts

Azure IoT Edge Development Environment

Hello Edge

Developing and Debugging Edge Modules

Analytics on the Edge

Device Provisioning Service

Azure IoT Edge Security

Azure DevOps for IoT Edge Solutions

iot.title: IoT Information Processing in an Increasingly Connected World
iot.author: Leon Strous and Vinton G.1 Cerf2
iot.description:
This volume presents a comprehensive cross-domain perspective on IoT, addressing the technical challenges of architecture, interoperability, and data processing in a hyper-connected global network. It bridges the gap between hardware implementation and societal impact, exploring how vast amounts of data are securely managed and utilized across diverse industries. The text is essential for understanding the standardization efforts, security frameworks, and software middleware required to support the next generation of IoT ecosystems.

Chapters (Key Sections)

Hardware, Networks, and Data: Exploring the physical layer and connectivity standards.

Software: Middleware, platforms, and architectural patterns.

Context and Situation Awareness: How IoT systems perceive and react to environments.

Privacy and Security: Trust models, encryption, and data protection.

User-Centric IoT: Human-computer interaction and usability in smart systems.

IoT Applications: Real-world case studies in healthcare, cities, and industry.

iot.title: Machine Learning, Big Data, and IoT for Medical Informatics
iot.author: Dr. Pardeep Kumar ,Dr. Yugal Kumar ,Dr. Mohammad A. Tawhid
iot.description:
This reference work explores the convergence of machine learning, big data analytics, and the Internet of Things to revolutionize modern healthcare systems and patient monitoring. It provides a comprehensive framework for processing the massive influx of medical data from wearable devices, focusing on real-time decision-making and predictive diagnostics. The text also addresses critical challenges such as data security, privacy protocols, and the deployment of intelligent algorithms in cloud-based medical environments.

Chapters List

Introduction to Internet of Things (IoT) in Healthcare

Big Data Analytics for Intelligent Healthcare Management

Machine Learning Algorithms for Medical Informatics

Deep Learning for Medical Image Analysis

Security and Privacy Issues in IoT-based Healthcare

Cloud and Fog Computing for Medical Data Processing

Wearable Sensors and Devices for Patient Monitoring

Blockchain Technology for Electronic Health Records

Predictive Analytics for Disease Diagnosis

Case Studies in Smart Healthcare Systems

iot.title: Build Your Own IoT Platform
iot.author: Anand Tamboli
iot.description:
This practical guide empowers developers to design and construct a custom Internet of Things platform from the ground up, bypassing costly commercial alternatives. It walks through the end-to-end architecture, from device connectivity and protocol selection to data storage and real-time visualization. Readers gain the technical know-how to integrate open-source tools into a scalable, secure, and fully controllable IoT ecosystem.

Chapters List

Introduction to IoT

IoT Strategy

The IoT Platform

Connectivity

Device Management

Data Management

Analytics

User Interface

External Systems Integration

Security

IoT Project Execution

iot.title: IoT 2.0 and the INTERNET of TRANSFORMATION (Web of Things and Digital Twins)
iot.author: Stefano Nativi, Alexander Kotsev
iot.description:
This report investigates the maturity and evolution of the Internet of Things (IoT) into "IoT 2.0," emphasizing its role as a key engine for digital transformation.
It explores the shift from simple connectivity to intelligent, interoperable systems driven by the Web of Things (WoT) and Digital Twins. The text analyzes global data sources, including patents and scientific publications, to identify emerging trends, technical challenges, and the socio-economic impact of this technological convergence.   

Chapters (Key Sections)

Introduction and Methodology

IoT Reference Framework   

IoT (Communications) Protocols: Gateways Implementations

Security Aspects

IoT Platforms and Ecosystems

Convergence Time: Addressing Interoperability Challenges (OCF, OneM2M, Mozilla IoT)

The W3C Web of Things (WoT) Initiative

IoT 2.0, Digital Age, Local Data Ecosystems, and the Internet of Transformation

IoT Landscape Analysis (Industry 4.0, Smart Home, Wearables)

Analysis of IoT Uptake: Emerging Trends
